content.question: Which of the following best describes the difference between "many" (Paragraph 3) and "others" (Paragraph 4)?

choices.label: The first group does not intend to act, while the second group does.
The first group is closer to an ideal, while the second group is fundamentally flawed.
The first group is more positive, while the second group is more pessimistic.
The first group is able but disinterested, while the second group lacks talent but is willing to act.

content.answer: The first group does not intend to act, while the second group does.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Recognize and explain the use of methods of development to accomplish a purpose.
